What do you mean with old index?
By calling mergeDocument(...) without any mapping, it passes all variables to the result document. Then merging the other variables on top.
In the past the method was called index. For me it looks weird  that it is called merge but anyway.
Agree. A good topic for another day 😅
I'm wondering why we haven't found this issue before 😅
Yeah 🙈
Do you remember why this is called strictly ? 😅

I checked it. Strictly means here that an exception is thrown when a mapping cannot be applied (i.e. no variable or nested property with the given name). The other method doesn't fail in this case. But it seems that we don't use the non-strict version of this anywhere 🤔
Ah ok thanks. Maybe we can delete it in a separate issue?
